item.title: FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time sales top one million
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/fantasy-life-i-the-girl-who-steals-time-sales-top-one-million

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

New update adds camera perspective toggle and other enhancements.

Total sales for slow-life RPG FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time have surpassed one million units, publisher LEVEL-5 and developer LEVEL-5 Osaka announced. Considering the current sales momentum, LEVEL-5 said it expects the title to surpass one million units sold within June.

FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on May 21 worldwide, followed by Switch 2 on June 5. It sold 500,000 copies within its first two days of release, and 800,000 copies within 10 days.

Additionally, the version 1.3.1 version update for the game is now available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series, and PC, and the version 1.3.0 update is now available for Switch 2 and Switch. New features include the ability to toggle the camera perspective between “Far” and “Normal,” updated controls so that “Water Plants” can now be performed with a different button from “SowSeeds” and “Harvest,” an option to re-listen to Life Songs, Switch 2 graphics enhancements, an automatic lock-on option, and more.
